definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Either put in enough firemen to put the fire out or get out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 不派足消防员将火灭掉，那就让他们撤出那房子。

sentences.english: How can we get rid of all these flies in the kitchen?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能把厨房里地这些苍蝇统统灭掉呢？

sentences.english: Genghis Khan didn't destroy it, this was by luck medium to have already destine as well.
sentences.chinese: 成吉思汗没有灭掉它，这侥幸中也有注定。

sentences.english: Finally, chu destroyed by the state of qin.
sentences.chinese: 终于，楚国被秦国灭掉了。

sentences.english: Put out your cigarette. It's a shop here.
sentences.chinese: 灭掉你的烟，这里是商场。

sentences.english: I want to play a little out of a Lianliankan on Valentine's day.
sentences.chinese: 情人那天我一定要去玩连连看一点灭掉一对。

sentences.english: In a startup, if you bet on the wrong technology, your competitors will crush you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对技术押错宝了，竞争对手就会来灭掉你。

definition: to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
